Talk_0001:
While Tauro and I were taking a break, he
asked me, "Hey, Calip, what attracted you
to join the Zonai Survey Team?"<sp:0:4:0>A little flustered, I answered that I heard
its research division was led by a brilliant
man by the name of Tauro.<sp:0:4:0>Because of you, essentially.<sp:0:4:0>I meant it sincerely, and in my heart,
I longed to continue...<sp:0:4:0>"You're not like these other dullards, you
know. You immediately grasp the breadth
of my vision."<sp:0:4:0>Of course, no such thing passed my lips.<sp:0:4:0>But I am certain that Tauro, and no one
else, is the man who can help the world
see my indescribable worth.
Talk_0002:
Our leader Tauro has done nothing
but surprise me since I joined the
Zonai Survey Team.<sp:0:4:0>One day, I arrived at the research site to
find him sitting on bare earth as he stared
at a stone slab.<sp:0:4:0>I wished him a good morning, and to that
he turned to me and said...<sp:0:4:0>"Ah, Calip. Sorry I didn't notice you.
Working overtime today, huh?"<sp:0:4:0>I thought back to the night before. As I
was heading in, I saw Tauro sitting on
bare earth, examining a stone slab.<sp:0:4:0>It hit me then—he had stayed up all
through the night puzzling over the
slab, never moving from his perch.<sp:0:4:0>I felt a profound envy of his ability to
focus so completely that the passing of
time escaped his notice.
Talk_0003:
It's a researcher's duty to use his wisdom
and intuition to bring to light historical
truths which the ruins would keep secret.<sp:0:4:0>We carry on the work of our forebears and
continue our pursuit tirelessly, then pass
what we learn to those who come after.<sp:0:4:0>Our leader Tauro understands well that
this is not a task that can be completed
in a single generation.<sp:0:4:0>He says this is why he wants to make so
many discoveries, even if the credit to
whom they belong is lost.<sp:0:4:0>That's the sort of man Tauro is. But I,
Dr. Calip, won't be so easily satisfied.<sp:0:4:0>My discoveries will be noteworthy, to be
sure, but it is my name that I want to live
on forever.<sp:0:4:0>Not just in peoples' memories, but in
books, stone tablets, and—if I might be
a trifle immodest—landmarks!<sp:0:4:0>Calip Valley, Calip River, the Calip Hills...
My dreams recognize no boundaries!
                                                -Dr. Calip
